title: Performative Activists are the New Epidemic
description:
Go to https://ground.news/kidology and subscribe for 40% off unlimited access this month with the Vantage Subscription. To stay informed on breaking news and to improve your news diet.

Salutations, and thank you so much for watching and giving me the time of day. These are clearly some very contentious times so I do implore you to all be respectful and considerate in the comments below. It is not only completely fine but inevitable that we'll all have different opinions, perspectives and moral/life outlooks. Nobody is a "g*noc*de denier", "terrorist" or responsible for human tragedy and suffering for having opinions and personal histories that don't align to our own. We can and I do have faith that we will do better! Virtue signalling isn't helping mend divisions or create a better modern world for anybody but a few wealthy virtue signallers, influencers, and political bodies who thrive, make money, and win political clout on making everybody else feel either inadequate or sanctimonious in their own right. All it does is further dehumanise and disregard human life. 

Please don't try to infer my (a)politics or general views from a video about virtue signalling: You will come to the wrong conclusionsüòâ.

All the very best to South Africans voting tomorrow, and I can only hope for a better future for us all irrespective of our skin colour. It's been too long on this path to nothingness for too many South Africans who deserve so, so much better from our beautiful country and everything we've all gone through. 

Best to you all, and thank you for your comments and engagement with me.

NOTE: For those interested, I‚Äôd just like to explain why I used the 2020 Plastic Surgery Statistics Report published by the American Association of Plastic Surgeons rather than the 2022 Plastic Surgery Report. For pretty self-explanatory reasons, the 2022 report chose to only include statistics on patients aged 18-19 whereas the 2020 report included data on patients aged 13-19. The 2022 report makes it seem as if the number of labiaplasty patients has gone down when, actually, going off the footnotes data is only included for 18-19 year olds. The 2022 footnote reads: ‚ÄúWhile patients under the age of eighteen may access plastic surgery procedures under physician guidance and with the approval of a parent or guardian, this is atypical and the majority of cases within this data set are focused on the ages eighteen to nineteen years‚Äù (p.p.20). title: The growing hypocrisy of the LGBTQ "safe space" debate (& the demonisation of "cis straight men")
description:
Try Rocket Money for free: https://RocketMoney.com/kidology 

VIDEO DISCLAIMER
Recently, there's been a lot of conversation and debate around "safe spaces" and who is allowed in them on the basis of...profiling people. I do want to emphasise (as I say in the video) that I am not saying that people who cosplay their minority status aren't minorities. I think their is a recent glamorisation of being part of particular minority identities/demographics that really isn't true to the lived experiences of most minorities inhabiting those identities/demographics. It's "trendy" to be oppressed for some of these minorities but, for most, it either isn't trendy or is something they are indifferent to in their day-to-day lives. This has bizarre ramifications when it comes to how minorities are perceived, treated, lumped together and "tokenised" not just by everybody else but especially by cosplaying minorities who increasingly prove themselves incapable of appreciating the very things they are allegedly fighting for: an appreciation and respect for diversity, difference, tolerance and the humanisation of individuals. It's disappointing that we're going down this path and I hope that, sooner rather than later, we change course. Thank you so much for watchingüßê, and I'll see you in the next one!

title: Men are lost.
description:
Men are lost and we need to not only talk about it but care about it. Too much discourse on the matter, particularly from the Left, tends to see it as a non-issue or something that men should just "get over". The Right also tends to see men as worthless if they don't fit into the cookie-cut traditional definition and confinement of masculinity; something that is impossible for most men to achieve in this day and age. In their own way, they've abandoned men and are keeping them preoccupied with conspiracies and scapegoats rather than dealing with the real issues at hand. One thing that the legacy of Nelson Mandela has taught me is that we get nowhere in wishing the same kind of suffering and harm to our adversaries. Men's health impacts us all. So, let's have a conversation and be as empathetic as possible. I adore you all.

title: "Addressing Chud Logic..." continued after tech issues (Part 2)
description:

title: @BrittanySimon and Kidology in DEEP CONVERSATION
description:
On Monday, January 30th, @BrittanySimon spoke with @KidologyCO about "the WHY of [Kidology's] life and work". Brittany Simon is a Professional Conversationalist and Listener who is also the co-founder of The Levels (a fascinating way to observe people's introspection level):

*SUBSCRIBE TO BRITTANY SIMON:* https://www.youtube.com/@BrittanySimon
Exploring The Levels - The Brittany Simon Podcast (ep.5) - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kk9pY...

@zahrabahjawi867
@therelyk9203 
@defmeta (Noah Brown)
@gloriaogara 
@oneigboboy 
@üéÄ Rini ;; all I want üéÄ  
@emmelinereinhardt9260 

~TIMESTAMPS~
0:00 Salutations
2:49 Explaining *‚ÄòTHE LEVELS‚Äô* by Brittany Simon and how they‚Äôve personally helped me
9:58 The ‚Äòacademic‚Äô bubble | Why Kidology haven‚Äôt spoken to @destiny 
16:40 What ‚Äúbubble‚Äù is Kidology from? What ‚Äúbubble(s)‚Äù does Kidology fit into? 
23:55 A *‚ÄúGREY CHILD‚Äù* explained | Level 2s and 3s compared and related 
30:49 How do you feel about creating your own bubble in the future? | Being rebellious and progressive in a different way | Nomads 
40:50 Incels | Why is Kidology *‚ÄúKIND TO INCELS‚Äù* ? | Why Brittany doesn‚Äôt think @JustPearlyThings and @Sneako are bad people (and I agree) 
51:56 *BRITTANY‚ÄôS DECISION* between s*x work and philosophy (and why she chose philosophy) | Why did Kidology choose the ‚ÄúYouTube bubble‚Äù? 
57:39 Posing as a *NIHILIST*
1:00:40 Does Kidology ever see a future where she has no obligation to post on YouTube? 
1:07:55 *‚ÄúWe force ourselves to be a version of ourselves that we‚Äôre not in order to be close to people we were never meant to be close to.‚Äù* ‚Äì Brittany Simon  
1:12:00 Modern *FRIENDSHIPS* 
1:31:15 How does someone qualify to be Kidology‚Äôs partner? | *POLITICS* as ‚Äútrying to change reality‚Äù re. the personal being political 
1:34:26 *DATING* for potentiality vs. dating for the present person as they are + changing | Kidology‚Äôs relationship to *GOD*
1:40:00 *JORDAN PETERSON* + storytelling | The value of *RELIGION* and *HISTORY* | ‚ÄúWondering‚Äù re. God and/or mystery | Requiring God to find joy or not
1:47:15 *DATING POLITICALLY* and not knowing your partner
1:52:15 What did Kidology want from a conversation with Brittany Simon? | Finding out that *YOUR IDOLS ARE HUMAN* 
1:59:56 Why *THE LEVELS DON‚ÄôT MATTER* , according to Brittany Simon | Using the language of ‚Äúbubbles‚Äù as an explanation rather than an insult
2:02:40 *F.D SIGNIFIER* and how Kidology felt about being *‚ÄúCANCELLED‚Äù BY THE LEFT* | Brittany gets it and validates Kidology‚Äôs reality (and The Left‚Äôs)! 
2:17:10 ‚ÄúHow is your bladder doing?‚Äù | Which bubble gives Brittany Simon the most joy? | Luck and ‚Äúbeing right‚Äù
2:26:05 Which bubble gives Kidology the most joy? | Making a bubble for yourself vs. making a bubble with others
2:29:58 Conflicting bubbles | Toxic bubbles 
2:24:41 The importance of having a *KIND PARTNER* | @FreshFitMiami and their audience as a reinforcing *‚ÄúYES TEAM‚Äù* 
2:50:54 Can [modern] identities withstand the test of time? | *POLITICS IS MISERY* | ‚ÄúVisiting bubbles‚Äù and ‚Äúbubble hopping‚Äù
2:55:42 ‚ÄúThe Levels are for you as an individual‚Ä¶everyone should be like themselves‚Äù and not like you 
2:58:05 Brittany Simon moving to Europe as an American re. *STEREOTYPES* | The different kinds of being alive
3:01:23 What is Kidology‚Äôs favourite part about existing? | *LIVING IN THE MOST PRESENT* 
3:05:53 What is Kidology‚Äôs favourite part about existence? | *FAITH IN OTHER PEOPLE*

title: Kindly, do better.
description:
~ Chapters ~
0:00 INTRODUCTION

4:56 PART I - THE CURRENT SITUATION
- 9:17 Political dogma | Macro vs. micro issues 
- 11:10 Postmodernism and its existential crises 
- 13:33 Lazy politics vs. labour 
- 25:08 It's always harder for The Left 

25:58 THE RIGHT'S ADVANTAGE
- 25:58 Nostalgia
- 27:04 Honesty 
- 32:41 Whiteness (as is)
- 33:39 Diverse membership criteria
- 35:36 Populism 

39:45 PART II - THE ONLINE LEFT
- 39:45 Cliques | Politics as friendship vs. politics as business
- 44:23 Alienating the working class
- 49:29 Andrew Tate | The Online Left vs. "ordinary people" 
- 58:56 "Abstract people"
- 1:04:15 That "VICE Debate" 

1:08:36 A CONCLUSION?

~ A note of caution ~
Just in case you are wondering, *I am apolitical.* I do stay very politically informed, primarily due to my own curiosity and interest. However, I do not participate in politics nor vote strategically. This is purely because of my context - I am a minority with very little socio-political power yet my human rights are sufficiently protected under EU and international law. I am not conservative nor right-wing. I am anti-neoliberalism as it manifests itself contemporarily; but I can appreciate its theoretical value. Perhaps, some day or due to circumstance, I will engage in politics; however, at this point in my life, I do not care for it. 

*This video is purely analytical.* Please do remember that.

I adore you all, lefties and righties alikeüíã.

~ Definitions ~
‚ú¶ THE POLITICAL SPECTRUM - https://twitter.com/kidology_co/status/1608568753230602241 [This is based purely on theory re. North America and N. Europe] *Neoliberalism, for instance, historically is more to the right; however, I would argue that its prevalence since c.1979 has shifted its ideas and appeal more centre-left
‚ú¶ THE LEFT - Encompasses political ideologies centred on egalitarianism and social equality (e.g., social equity via social reform) | Influenced by critical theories of society and socio-political identities | A belief in relatively expansive government role and influence in achieving social progress
‚ú¶ THE RIGHT -  Political ideologies that place civil rights and liberties at the centre of decision-making | Minimal government intervention in the lives of individuals/families/federal states/communities |  An observance of natural laws re. morality, social hierarchy based on merit/divine rights/tradition/history to direct and order society and culture | Anti-communism 

~ Primary sources are fully referenced throughout the video ~ 
*NB. Just because some of these sources have acted as resources it does NOT mean that Kidology condones or is promoting what has been said. Information does not equate to endorsement.*
‚ú¶ FULL SEND PODCAST feat. Andrew Tate and The Nelk Boys - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kJyTkLgW_KI
‚ú¶ WOMEN'S HOUR feat. Hadley Freeman - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OSNej9zV5T4
‚ú¶ UnHerd can also be found on YouTube and Twitter - https://unherd.com/ 
‚ú¶ FINA's updated policy on trans men and women competing at a professional level - https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/22063914-fina-policy-on-mens-and-womens-competition
‚ú¶ How The Left Helped Make Andrew Tate Popular by  @Vaush  - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xhb8z1a7vuw
‚ú¶ THE VICE DEBATE - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EEIvWNhuL8U&t=2s

~ Music ~

title: The moral panic around fertility rates and depression is misplaced | KIDS' CLIPS
description:
‚ûü What are KIDS' CLIPS? 

Kids' Clips are my shorter form videos centred on more topical, less research-intensive and more (personal) opinion-based commentary. If you don't have a lot of time or patience, these are the bitesized videos for you and your schedule. 

 ‚ûü How often are KIDS' CLIPS uploaded to YouTube?

Every Monday, Wednesday and Friday evening I will be uploading a Kids' Clip for you to engage with at your leisure. HOWEVER, if you would like early access I upload ALL THREE KIDS' CLIPS to my Patreon [Kidology] every Friday evening/Saturday morning. So, if you can't wait until the week, be sure to pick a tier and I will see you on my Patreon, brethren! 

 ‚ûü Does this mean you won't be doing livestreams or making your typical video essays and commentary content? 

NO! Please do not worry yourself! This is just an additional channel feature. I have read your concerns and comments about the length of my videos and livestreams. This is what I have determined and devised to be a realistic resolution for us all: I don't disappear for weeks researching and editing a video, and you don't have to resort to plowing through a 4hr livestream to figure out what I think about something and have a conversation with other Kidologists. So, I sincerely hope this works out for us all. I will still be livestreaming and uploading my typical videos. There is absolutely no need to worry. Thank you as always for your patience and support.

title: CORPORATIONS + TECHNOCRACY [Corporations capitalise off social issues...and the future feels bleak]
description:
~‚¶ø Thank you so much to C H R I S T O P H E R for this fantastic topic suggestion! ‚¶ø~

"Could you talk about the disingenuous moral grandstanding behind the marketing strategies of corporations (e.g., Burger King selling gay pride burgers) when these types of corporations do the least possible for their own workers...[j]ust about the overall hypocrisy and the shamelessness of these corporations...and if corporations should be [morally neutral or withhold their moral position from the public] when that could set a bad precedent as corporations could be mistaken to be trailblazers" - Christopher

~‚¶ø t i m e s t a m p s ‚¶ø~ 
0:00 Salutations ‚Äì Do you prefer longer videos (50+ minute video essays) or shorter videos (20- minute video essays)? 
6:46 The rhinoplasty video 
8:30 Fast fashion and buying fast fashion (also at 1:45:39) 
14:25 Voting for our next technocratic/epistocratic leader of the ‚Äúfree‚Äù world ‚Äì Elon wins‚Ä¶over Zuckerberg‚Äôs toes (‚ÄúVOTE RESULT: Elon Musk would be the most suitable leader in a potential technocracy.‚Äù [Zahra Bahjawi])
25:15 Quiet quitting explained 
34:10 The myth of Americans hating their jobs | Why I loved my retail job | Labour pre, during and post-pandemic 
45:55 ‚ÄúHow do you feel about the people who just want to get their work done and go, no socialising intended?‚Äù (Mexican Kitchen) 
49:40 friendships at work and the daunting feeling of being ‚Äòreplaceable‚Äô
56:33 QUESTION TO CHAT: Who enjoys interacting with their co-workers? Thumbs up or down 
1:04:45 Nosy, gossipy colleagues (and why I love them) 
1:08:56 ‚ÄúDo you think millennials are overeducated?‚Äù (Eckendenker) 
1:21:24 Burger King ‚Äì What do you think of the ‚ÄòPride whooper‚Äô? | Why corporations fail to genuinely connect to their consumers re. social issues
1:28:40 Marketing at Gen Z
1:34:30 Johnny Cash 
1:35:07 Is corporate wokeness dead?
1:39:25 The corporate apology 
1:43:16 ‚ÄúThis reminds me, corporations don't just profit off social issues, but issues themselves. Look at pharma in America profiteering off people BEING sick, so they want to keep people sick.‚Äù (Jerry Vang) 
1:50:31 Being a ‚Äòconsumer‚Äô vs. being a ‚ÄòGOOD CONSUMER‚Äô
1:55:46 Are Gen Z distrustful of corporations? (‚ÄúAs a Gen Z I think people don‚Äôt trust big corporations but trust small businesses too much.‚Äù [Paradox Junky] | ‚ÄúGen Z are very materialistic but in a different way I think.‚Äù [Veronica])
2:03:25 EA Games and Crunch Culture ‚Äì efficiency over art 
2:11:41 QUESTION TO CHAT: If your employer had to pick either being socially conscious or rewarding its existing employees with benefits and rewards, which would you prefer it do? (‚ÄúInclusive marketing is way cheaper than employee benefits!‚Äù [hakkun1]) (and also 2:26:59)
2:13:35 ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt understand why you allow yourself to go to Primark.‚Äù (Noah Brown)
2:19:01 ‚ÄúAsian governments banning the Sims is like China banning Winnie The Pooh because Pooh looks like Xi Jinping.‚Äù (Jerry Vang) ‚Äì ‚ÄúYour social credit score would skyrocket.‚Äù (Mexican Kitchen) | ‚ÄúPurge me Xi Jing Daddy!‚Äù (Ellis Hayward) 
2:24:53 Video game development then vs. now | Corporate monopolies and why we look to corporations vs. elected representatives 
2:39:35 I‚Äôm going in 7 minutes 
2:40:15 Who is responsible for modern work/consumer culture (now and in the future)? Corporations or their customers?
2:46:14 Shareholders and their power
2:56:12 Feet (‚ÄúWill we be seeing your grippers in the video?‚Äù [Mexican Kitchen]) ‚Äì Why are feet so weird? | Joshua Kregg‚Äôs Tarzan feet | Veronica‚Äôs ballerina feet | Liam Neeson‚Äôs feet
3:13:49 Teeth (‚ÄúI bought this Kendall Jenner teeth whitening pen and it smelled so bad I had to throw it away.‚Äù [Veronica])
3:21:11 Goodbyes and next video

title: Parasocial relationships as the new "real"
description:
‚ùùGood luck to our super moderator Zahra Bahjawi for her three midterms this week! Kat2123 did an absolutely fantastic job, but we sure did miss Zahra!‚ùû

‚ùùSOME INTERESTING COMMENTS FROM THE CHAT‚ùû
* ‚ÄúI think parasocial relationships just allow us to present a better and less disappointing side to other people over what would occur in real life, more fake and shallower but it feels nice.‚Äù (yusuf) 
* ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs bad because as a Gen Z I feel like it‚Äôs slowly replacing in-person communication because it puts a band aid on the wound of loneliness.‚Äù (Venus) 
* ‚Äú‚Ä¶I love that the internet provides me outlets for discourse on my niche topics of interest. I have real life friends, but no one to watch Drag Race with me and pick it apart, lol.‚Äù (Kait Why)
* ‚ÄúWhile parasocial friendship is really amazing, ghosting is what has made me not depend too much on virtual friendship.‚Äù (Jaehoon Jung) 
* ‚ÄúMy life is kind of sad‚Ä¶Too many relationships with streamers who will never learn anything about me.‚Äù (pedro luiz)
* ‚ÄúI‚Äôve found that parasocial relationships can be a good way to lessen the influence of social determinism on the viewer. In getting ‚Äòacquainted‚Äô with, say, filmmakers, writers, musicians, one gets to see and feel other ways to live and consider the world. Coming from a small town in France, these ‚Äòrelationships‚Äô have truly made me encounter ideas and ways of being that I would never have encountered in ‚Äúreal‚Äù life.‚Äù (Spilman)
* ‚Äúyes‚Äù (The Relyk)
* ‚ÄúMost of my social interactions with friends are through a group chat‚Ä¶which actually turned pretty toxic and took a toll on my mental health. I had to back myself away from it which was difficult.‚Äù (digitaleyez)
* ‚Äú‚Ä¶As somebody with chronic pain, parasocial relations have been so important to me to connect with others in similar situations.‚Äù (Kerrie O‚ÄôNeill) 
* ‚ÄúI honestly wonder if we will ever get to the point that we can describe different texting styles like we describe dialects.‚Äù (Kata) 
* ‚ÄúCannabis is herbal alcohol, ew.‚Äù (Samurai Yun)
* ‚ÄúKidology talking about Chomsky is literally proving how discourse, and being exposed to it, is a positive force in education.‚Äù (Noah Brown)
* ‚ÄúI want to be a professional parasocialite.‚Äù (Jerry Vang) 
* ‚ÄúI saw that video of Miss Simon and it had a hint of mean-spiritedness. Disagreeing is fine but that was a bit much tbh.‚Äù (Wendy B. Screen)
* ‚Äú‚Ä¶I‚Äôd like to ask if voting would be considered parasocial and if it is, how does it affect it?‚Äù (lucas)
* ‚ÄúI think of relationships as a sort of energy exchange. The exchanged energy needs to be in balance. And that can only happen when it is well defined. All relationships should be well defined.‚Äù (Chaos Joerg)
* ‚ÄúI wish both mental and physical health could be considered a human right.‚Äù (indrinita)
* ‚ÄúTikTok therapy is like fast food.‚Äù (Jerry Vang) | TikTok is the new therapy it seems.‚Äù (Jamaal Clarke)
* ‚Äú‚Ä¶I think it‚Äôs very commendable how Max [MrGirl] just wants people to radically advocate for themselves in such a far-from-social-norm way. Such a shame people cannot seem to read him properly.‚Äù (magicalflyingNEMO)
* ‚ÄúIs having pets also kind of parasocial?‚Äù (vivvy)

‚ùùREADING SUGGESTIONS | CONTENT MENTIONED‚ùû
* http://visual-memory.co.uk/daniel/Documents/short/horton_and_wohl_1956.html (Mass Communication and Para-social Interaction by Donald Horton and R. Richard Wohl, 1956)
* https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D433VKW18xM (Teaching MrGirl How Relationships Work [ft. Destiny] by notsoErudite) 
* https://www.theguardian.com/media/2021/nov/16/the-unknown-is-scary-why-young-women-on-social-media-are-developing-tourettes-like-tics (‚ÄúThe unknown is scary‚Äù: Why young women on social media are developing Tourette‚Äôs-like tics) 
* https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cbSwhMeYqtQ (Dr. K: Reckless by mrgirl)

title: THOUGHT CRIMES: The fatal flaw of the internet‚Ä¶and my confession
description:
The first 1,000 people to use the link or my code kidology will get a 1 month free trial of Skillshare: 
https://skl.sh/kidology05221

‚Ä¢‚îà‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ TIMESTAMPS ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚îà‚Ä¢ 
0:00 Introduction 
1:55 Skillshare sponsorship 
4:51 Liam Neeson Revisited
16:18 "Thinking" in the internet age 
24:28 Thought crimes 

‚Ä¢‚îà‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ SUGGESTED LIAM NEESON FILMOGRAPHY ‚Ä¢‚îà‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
[Liam Neeson is not one of my favourite actors - he's good-looking but his films aren't really my cup of tea - but he is definitely good in some lesser known projects]

‚Üí Silence (2016) - The novel by  Sh≈´saku End≈ç got me onto this film. There's a 1970s film adaptation which I personally didn't like so much. Definitely read the novel - it is exceptional and a fascinating history. Based on actual events, the film follows two Jesuit priests in the 17th century who go to Nagasaki in search of their mentor Crist√≥v√£o Ferreira (played by Liam). Their mission is to locate him and to convert and protect Japanese converts under ruthless persecution. They discover that their mentor has renounced his faith. A very philosophical and psychologically tormenting film. Adam Driver and Andrew Garfield had exceptional chemistry. I loved it!
 
‚Üí A Walk Among the Tombstones (2014) - I am a big fan of the book series by Lawrence Block and I absolutely loved this film adaptation. It isn't for the faint-hearted and it didn't do very well by Hollywood standards, but I thought the aesthetic and tone was very true to the book (The Sins of the Fathers by Lawrence Block).

‚Üí Schindler's List (1993) - Again, read the book titled 'Schindler's Ark' by Thomas Keneally. It is based on the true story of German industrial magnet Oskar Schindler (played by Liam) who morphed from an immoral businessman profiting off cheap labour and NSDAP ideology into remarkably using his 'clout' for exceptional good. This is definitely necessary reading and watching!

‚Üí Kinsey (2004) - Based on the life of the infamous Alfred Kinsey played by Liam Neeson.

‚Üí Before & After (1996) - This is a family drama and really brings into question whether family comes before morality. Liam plays the father of a teenaged son who is accused of a terrible crime. 

‚Üí Ordinary Love (2019) - This is just an absolutely beautiful and wholesome film. It's very sad but it's truly touching to see what a real and ordinary marriage can look like between two people who are exclusively dependent on one another for meaning and love. 

‚Üí Michael Collins (1996) - If you want to learn about modern Irish history, this is a great place to start. And it starred Alan Rickman so...

‚Üí Widows (2018) - Viola Davis can do no wrong and she was exceptional in this lead role. Her interviews about the mixed marriage she portrays alongside Liam Neeson are fascinating and handled with such sophistication and insight. The cast is exceptional and the overall concept (no spoilers!) is genius.  

‚Üí The Good Mother (1988) - "The Good Mother explores feelings and beliefs about children's exposure to adult sexuality and challenges society's growing reliance upon courts to settle complex private and ethical matters" (Wikipedia). I watched this when I was a teenager alongside watching 'Kramer vs. Kramer' (1979). If you're interested in the evolution and dilemmas of the American family court system, these are some unforgettable films to watch.

‚Üí Home (2006) - This is a documentary film all about the concept of "home" as it applies to New York's A-Lister residents, most of whom have Irish roots.

‚Üí The Ballad of Buster Scruggs (2018) - This is a Western anthology film. The cinematography is just mesmerising. Although pretty funny, it is very dark and reflective. 

* Atlanta (2016 - ) - Aside from Liam's cameo in the latest episode of season 3, this series is brilliant. If you like Donald Glover and/or Childish Gambino, this series is scripture.

title: A ‚Äúdefence‚Äù of CreepShow Art (because why not at this point?)
description:
NB. Having compared Shannon's typical video content to her latest video upload, I would argue that she is working with a legal team based on the legal jargon and style of argument she used. The difference in tone, semantics, and video style demonstrated to me that her video is likely intended for more than just a regular monetised upload to YouTube: It is a legal document which she can use, quite effectively, in proving that she has been defamed. Her video, in my opinion, was NOT made for her YouTube audience or for Emily Artful which explains why it has gotten the overwhelmingly negative response that it has.

NB. I am not a lawyer! And, no, I don't watch Law & Order. I just read a lot and am obsessively analytical. This video was made for my own amusement more than anything else. 

NB. Please be respectful, civil, and kosher in the comment section. I am not a horrible person for holding an opinion and stance that may differ to yours: I respect you and I ask that you do the same. Thank you so much for your time and for listening to what I have to say.

TIMESTAMPS
0:00 Introduction

description:

title: "Creative Work" Is Not A Thing
description:
So, according to The School of Life, it is possible to find "creative work" because creativity is not exclusive to particular occupations or domains. You wanna be the next Madonna? Great, but everybody's trying to be a Pop Queen, so you may be better suited to honing those skills and directing them toward...performance arts consultancy? Yes, it's a completely different occupation to the one you intended to go for, but you are essentially utilising the same skills and energy into something which is more likely to provide you with a steady income, enough to pay off your mortgage, and a 0% threat of being cancelled. 

I don't like this idea one bit, and I would be intrigued to hear what your personal thoughts are on this. Is it possible to find and cultivate creativity in the modern world as we know it? 

Do subscribe and follow me on Twitter for updates and very random tweets @kidology_co .

Thank you for your time! 

P.S. Q&A Part II is currently being edited for those patiently waiting (thank you for your patience).

title: You're Wrong About Critical Theory
description:
Critical Theory is really not as big or frightening a threat as it is currently being made out to be by its critics. Culture wars are a thing of modern societies and life; they are a thing of (modern) politics and are pretty much here to stay for the long run. There is nothing to fear except change, and it is disingenuous to blame a theory and those who incorporate it into their lives and studies for the ambiguity and precariousness of change and our liberal age. I wouldn't bother buying their books! I made that mistake...

*Apologies for my lighting: I have not figured it out yet. I also filmed during a heatwave and clearly couldn't handle it.

Chapters:

0:00 Explanation
2:59 An Introduction; A Little Context 
8:54 How the critics of critical theory define Critical Theory
15:02 A Very Short Introduction to Critical Theory in Weimar Germany
16:40 The Institut f√ºr S*xualwissenschaft (an example of Critical Theory in practice and without communism at its core) 
23:53 The Political (according to Carl Schmitt) 
37:34 Concluding remarks 

I hope you enjoy this video. Do let me know your thoughts down below. I would be intrigued to read and respond to your own thoughts on the modern 'culture wars'.

Please keep in mind that this is entirely my opinion, that I am critiquing and not criticising any of these YouTubers for anything but some of the ideas and messages they are putting out.

title: The Whole NIKKI PHILLIPPI and DAN PHILLIPPI Adoption and Foster Care Saga | This is so messed up...
description:
Timestamps:

0:00 Intro
1:05 Who is Nikki Phillippi?
6:47 'We're going to be parents!'
12:47 Why Thailand? (Nikki and Dan decide to adopt from Thailand)
17:01 Nikki and Dan's (international) adoption criteria

39:48 Why no longer [the initially undisclosed country] Colombia?
47:40 International adoption vs. domestic adoption
49:02 A HUGE change of direction and 'calling'
52:28 'Fostering' = A shortcut to adoption
53:42 Foster care information in Tennessee / Lack of research exposed
57:03 Addressing 'the haters' by turning off the comments and blocking the ungodly 
58:17 Why no longer fostering?
01:01:00 An even HUGE(ER) change of direction!....
01:03:45 Nikki and Dan want biological children (after never wanting them) / 'Why I changed my mind about having babies'
01:10:13 Thank you for watching / RIP Bowser 

Summary:

This video is a comprehensive look into the (non-existent) adoption and foster care saga featured heavily on Nikki Phillippi's YouTube channel. All these events occurred in the span of no more than 15 months and represent why children should NEVER be on the internet. The YouTube adoption community has a lot to answer for, and this story is a perfect example of how harmful it can be. Nikki and Dan decide to adopt internationally, then to adopt domestically, then to foster domestically, and then to conceive naturally...all within a 12 month timeframe. There are so many undertones here of what has recently happened on Nikki Phillippi's channel (i.e., the announcement of their family dog Bowser being put down). Nikki's interpretation of biblical scripture, her use of conspiracy theories, and her saviour complex are explored in detail here. 

This took a lot of research and time, so I apologise for any potential mistakes in captions and dates. Any mistakes identified will be corrected immediately and acknowledged below. 

Thank you for watching! Subscribe and like if you enjoy this kind of thing. Also, follow me on Twitter (@kidology_co). 

RIP Bowserüïäüå¨üçÉ.

title: MANIFESTATION and THE LAW OF ATTRACTION are DANGEROUS | KIDOLOGY
description:
This video is about Manifestation, The Law of Attraction, and their, often times, dangerous and harmful influence in modern societies. Why, for instance, is New Age Thought making such a successful comeback, and what does this say about 'modern' human beings in general? 

All references have been acknowledged and cited in the video itself. All references have been used for educational purposes only and in no way to humiliate or personally affront anyone. All copyright material is fair use, has been cited in detail, and is publicly available.
